title: A1398 820-3787
message:
Hi.

I have this A1398 with no backlight issue. The initial problem was Q7706, I replaced it and got all voltages but no backlight I had output on PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT. the output voltages are coming and going as they like :) SCL and SDA lines are almost 5v and diode mode is good on all components. I checked all resistors and they are measuring good values. I also replaced Q7701. Ideas?

title: A1398 820-3787
message:
Try known good compatible LCD assembly.
Any history available, how Q7706 got damaged?

title: A1398 820-3787
message: I opened the top side of the lcd and found liquid damage on the lcd flex and connector. I replaced the connector on the lcd itself and the flex cable it flashed 2 times when on power and now i lost PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT. I'll recheck the circuit again

title: A1398 820-3787
message: I reconnected all and i got PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT on the lcd side, but it just flashed and no backlight

title: A1398 820-3787
message:
Is the voltage steady?
Tried known good LCD?

title: A1398 820-3787
message: When I get the 50v they are stable, but not every time I get them. When I don't get 50v to LCD , also I don't have PPBUS_SW_BKL output from Q7706

title: A1398 820-3787
message: Also I don't have a good know LCD to try at the moment

title: A1398 820-3787
message:
50V is too high; denotes bad connection with LED strips.
Probably problem into LCD assembly.

title: A1398 820-3787
message: Weird but it started working. I just connected the KB and it showed a backlight on the lcd it has been working since then. I will test it for some time, but it look great. We can close this thread Solved :)

title: A1398 820-3787
message: Morning. You were right 50v it's too high. after some time testing, it lost backlight again and it gets all voltages to the lcd connector on the lcd side. LCD backlight strip replacement next step?

title: A1398 820-3787
message:
Replacing the LED strip is not an easy job.
You should test with compatible LCD assembly.

title: A1398 820-3787
message: I've done led strip replacement and LCD only many times it's not an issue. I will open it inside maybe even the strip has liquid on it. I don't have another 2012/13 lcd assembly to try, only 2015 but they have different signals

title: A1398 820-3787
message:
Hi. Going back to this one. I got another LCD new for testing and still no backlight.

PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD - 5V
PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT - 54v
PPBUS_S0_LCDBKLT_PWR_SW is 11.4 and 0v on BKL_SW coming from U7701 to Q7701, not sure how it should be...

title: A1398 820-3787
message:
"PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT - 54v"
Connection to LEDs strip is broken; 39V is the expected voltage.

title: A1398 820-3787
message: Could it be that the lvds connector is making the issue since the LCD and lcd flex are new and all other stuff seem fine...

title: A1398 820-3787
message: Possibly; do you get 54V just on its pin?

title: A1398 820-3787
message: I have 54v from D7701 pin 2 toward the LCD connector and on the connector itself. With the old LCD, I also got on the lcd side same

title: A1398 820-3787
message:
Did you open old LCD to check the LEDs?

Just in case, check R7780.

title: A1398 820-3787
message: The old lcd was partially broken and i left it like that, but shows same with the new one. I'll check the resistor and revert

title: A1398 820-3787
message: R7780 it's good

title: A1398 820-3787
message: Checked voltage on its both pins too?

title: A1398 820-3787
message: Yes both sides it's good. I resoldered U7701 just to be sure and I replaced D7701 also, still the same. J5250 had some liquid damage, possible issue?

title: A1398 820-3787
message: btw I checked SMC_LID right away at the beginning of the repair and it was 3.4v

title: A1398 820-3787
message: Surprise! I have a backlight when the board is out of the housing  🥳  J5250 making the issue?

title: A1398 820-3787
message:
Hall sensor problem should disable image too, not just backlight.
Check its reaction approaching a magnet.

title: A1398 820-3787
message: I replaced J5250 and it started working, which is funny cause I already had the voltages correct. After a few days of testing, all seems fine :) Thanks for the assistance :D
